event.title: was first settled as early as 1795

data.event: Charleston was first settled as early as 1795 by Charles Vaughan.
The land was granted on July 14, 1802, by the Massachusetts General Court to John Lowell.

Known as T2 R5 NWP, or Township 2, Range 4, North of the Waldo Patent, it was incorporated on February 16, 1811, as New Charlestown, to distinguish it from Charlestown, Massachusetts, when that state included the province of Maine.
But in 1820, Maine achieved statehood, so any confusion between the two ceased.
Consequently, in 1827 the name was shortened to Charleston.

event.title: 1837, the Higgins Classical Institute was founded

data.event: In 1837, the Higgins Classical Institute was founded.
